author: Jim Carlton
title: Water, Water Everywhere Can’t Quell a Western Drought
text:
SAN FRANCISCO—Many Western reservoirs are full, and downpours have triggered floods and deadly mudslides in parts of California. But all that water isn’t enough to save the West from another drought.
Most of the region has slipped back into the drought conditions that have plagued it on and off for the past two decades—alarming water managers across several states. The dry conditions are fueling wildfires, threatening agriculture and hurting ski resorts.
...
